20101228211924.000|20101228211927.000|TR0|Catherine, thanks for joining us.  What on 
20101228211927.000|20101228211929.000|TR0|Earth are we looking at in those pictures?
20101228211929.000|20101228211931.000|TR0|
20101228211931.000|20101228211933.000|TR0|CATHERINE WRIGHT, COLLECTIONS MANAGER, 
20101228211933.000|20101228211935.000|TR0|MUSEUM OF THE CONFEDERACY: Well, what you 
20101228211935.000|20101228211938.000|TR0|are looking at is a secret message that 
20101228211938.000|20101228211940.000|TR0|was unopened for 147 years.  It was a 
20101228211940.000|20101228211942.000|TR0|coded message that was intended to be sent 
20101228211942.000|20101228211944.000|TR0|to a city under siege, and by the time the 
20101228211944.000|20101228211946.000|TR0|message was about to be delivered, the 
20101228211946.000|20101228211949.000|TR0|city had already fallen into the hands of 
20101228211949.000|20101228211951.000|TR0|the enemy and the message really no longer 
20101228211951.000|20101228211953.000|TR0|mattered.
20101228211953.000|20101228211955.000|TR0|
20101228211955.000|20101228211958.000|TR0|LEMON:  So, then some people --
20101228211958.000|20101228212000.000|TR0|
20101228212000.000|20101228212002.000|TR0|WRIGHT:  So it was brought back.
20101228212002.000|20101228212004.000|TR0|
20101228212004.000|20101228212006.000|TR0|LEMON: -- some people would say, OK, what 
20101228212006.000|20101228212009.000|TR0|took you so long to open it?
20101228212009.000|20101228212011.000|TR0|
20101228212011.000|20101228212013.000|TR0|WRIGHT:  Well, I think there's a lot of 
20101228212013.000|20101228212015.000|TR0|different museum curators who have the 
20101228212015.000|20101228212017.000|TR0|philosophy that you should never change 
20101228212017.000|20101228212020.000|TR0|any artifact which comes into your museum. 
20101228212020.000|20101228212022.000|TR0| And while I certainly ascribe to that, I 
20101228212022.000|20101228212024.000|TR0|do believe that museums and other 
20101228212024.000|20101228212026.000|TR0|institutions need to continue to do 
20101228212026.000|20101228212029.000|TR0|research on the items in their collection. 
20101228212029.000|20101228212031.000|TR0| And as long as they can do so without 
20101228212031.000|20101228212033.000|TR0|causing any physical harm or damage to the 
20101228212033.000|20101228212035.000|TR0|artifact, then they should certainly do 
20101228212035.000|20101228212037.000|TR0|whatever research they can.
20101228212037.000|20101228212040.000|TR0|
20101228212040.000|20101228212042.000|TR0|So I was sort of the head of a team of 
20101228212042.000|20101228212044.000|TR0|people at the museum who just decided that 
20101228212044.000|20101228212046.000|TR0|curiosity finally got the better of us.
20101228212046.000|20101228212048.000|TR0|
20101228212048.000|20101228212051.000|TR0|LEMON:  All right, so, Catherine, how did 
20101228212051.000|20101228212053.000|TR0|you decode the message? Was it high-tech 
20101228212053.000|20101228212055.000|TR0|computer software?
20101228212055.000|20101228212057.000|TR0|
20101228212057.000|20101228212100.000|TR0|WRIGHT:  Well, you could certainly use 
20101228212100.000|20101228212102.000|TR0|that today, but back in the Civil War, 
20101228212102.000|20101228212104.000|TR0|people would either use a metal decoder 
20101228212104.000|20101228212106.000|TR0|ring that would bear some resemblance to

20101228212108.000|20101228212111.000|TR0|Christmas Story" movie, or they could use 
20101228212111.000|20101228212113.000|TR0|a table that basically is a bunch of 
20101228212113.000|20101228212115.000|TR0|alphabets that are slightly staggered.  
20101228212115.000|20101228212117.000|TR0|And it is a little bit complicated, but 
20101228212117.000|20101228212119.000|TR0|you can sit down and figure it out with 
20101228212119.000|20101228212122.000|TR0|just a paper and pencil.
20101228212122.000|20101228212124.000|TR0|
20101228212124.000|20101228212126.000|TR0|LEMON:  OK, so tell me, who do you think 
20101228212126.000|20101228212128.000|TR0|sent this message and what does this tell 
20101228212128.000|20101228212131.000|TR0|you about the state of the war on that day?
20101228212131.000|20101228212133.000|TR0|
20101228212133.000|20101228212135.000|TR0|WRIGHT:  OK.  Well, if you imagine the 
20101228212135.000|20101228212137.000|TR0|city of Vicksburg, which is perched on the 
20101228212137.000|20101228212139.000|TR0|east side of the Mississippi river, is a 
20101228212139.000|20101228212142.000|TR0|very important stronghold in the Civil War 
20101228212142.000|20101228212144.000|TR0|because it basically would control who had 
20101228212144.000|20101228212146.000|TR0|access to -- to the river, which was a 
20101228212146.000|20101228212148.000|TR0|main route of transportation.
20101228212148.000|20101228212150.000|TR0|
20101228212150.000|20101228212153.000|TR0|And the person who sent a message was a 
20101228212153.000|20101228212155.000|TR0|Confederate general who was stationed on 
20101228212155.000|20101228212157.000|TR0|the opposite side of the river.  So he was 
20101228212157.000|20101228212159.000|TR0|sending the message to the general who had 
20101228212159.000|20101228212201.000|TR0|basically set up a series of defenses

20101228212204.000|20101228212206.000|TR0|hold off all of the Federals.  And, of 
20101228212206.000|20101228212208.000|TR0|course, that fellow -- all of his poor 
20101228212208.000|20101228212210.000|TR0|soldiers were starving.
20101228212210.000|20101228212213.000|TR0|
20101228212213.000|20101228212215.000|TR0|And so the message, apparently, was a 
20101228212215.000|20101228212217.000|TR0|response to the general who was under 
20101228212217.000|20101228212219.000|TR0|siege in the city.  And the message, as it 
20101228212219.000|20101228212221.000|TR0|was decoded reads, "General Pemberton, you 
20101228212221.000|20101228212224.000|TR0|can expect no help from this side of the 
20101228212224.000|20101228212226.000|TR0|river.  Let General Johnston know, if 
20101228212226.000|20101228212228.000|TR0|possible, when you can attack the same 
20101228212228.000|20101228212230.000|TR0|point on the enemy's line.  Inform me also 
20101228212230.000|20101228212232.000|TR0|and I will endeavor to make a diversion.  
20101228212232.000|20101228212235.000|TR0|I subjoin a dispatch from General 
20101228212235.000|20101228212237.000|TR0|Johnston," end quote.
